abstract: Georgia State Board of Pardons and Paroles rejects clemency application from Kelly Renee Gissendaner, the only woman on Georgia's death row; convicted of orchestrating her husband's 1997 murder, Gissendander was scheduled for execution on Sept 29, but federal courts were still considering her appeal at that time; board has even turned down a direct plea from Pope Francis to spare her life, and her lawyers have few options left to stop the execution.
lead_paragraph: Kelly Renee Gissendaner, who was convicted of orchestrating her husband’s 1997 murder, was put to death Wednesday after she exhausted her appeals.

headline.main: Georgia Executes Woman on Death Row Despite Clemency Bid and Pope’s Plea
headline.print_headline: Last Door Closes in Georgia for Woman on Death Row

snippet: Kelly Renee Gissendaner, who was convicted of orchestrating her husband’s 1997 murder, was put to death Wednesday after she exhausted her appeals.
